docs.lead_paragraph: THE record industry has come back, bigger and better than ever. Since its firm establishment shortly after 1900 it has been twice on the verge of disaster. The radio in the middle Twenties and the depression in the early Thirties caused it to totter, but each time the sobbing requiems were premature. 1941, peak year of recording, about 110-000,000 records were sold, 10,000,000 more than the previous high of 1921.

headline.main: Black Disks by Millions; Records of our songs and symphonies have become a big American industry Black Disks by Millions

docs.lead_paragraph: IF there's anything in the theory that a boy's devotion is to his mother, a girl's to her father, the theory should apply equally in New York City, London and New Guinea. That it doesn't so apply was stated the other day by Dr. M.F. Nimkoff. Among the Manus of New Guinea both boys and girls prefer their fathers.
